reviews.review: I love movies with a brain teaser. It was unpredictable and comedic with a few moments of heart pulling emotion. I recommend this movie for all fans of criminal-comedy. AMAZING ACTORS!
Excellent Comedy with great acting from Daniel Craig, Don Johnson, Chris Evans, Jamie Lee Curtis, all round terrific cast - highly recommend.
Loved all the twists and the great acting!
So refreshing! It was really entertaining to see how they did this whodunnit. Doesnâ€™t turn out how you think it would.

If you feel compelled to smugly declare that you figured it out before the end, just don't.  Knives Out is a good time for the fans of Agatha Christie, Hercule Poirot, Jessica Fletcher, and Clue. The tenets of a murder whodunit with its misdirecting clues are well applied. Our lead character Marta, played by Ana de Arnas, is given an odd characteristic that many people will buzz over. At any rate, as the deceased guy's last nurse/caretaker, she gives a good performance that draws the audience in and makes us care about the outcome for her. This is a really good ensemble cast. If you want to get your Don Johnson (Dakota's dad) fix, here is your movie. Chris Evans shows some range that is quite different than his Captain America persona. Christopher Plummer and Michael Shannon are consummate pros. There is even a rare brief in person performance by Frank Oz. As our private detective, Daniel Craig flawlessly inhabits a southern patois that I found simultaneously grating and completely credible. Even without a great deal to do, Jamie Lee Curtis owns her character and made me wonder why we don't see more performances from her in top tier films. Rian Johnson did a good job, including by giving us a study, only leaving out Colonel Mustard and the candlestick.
Boring just a clue remake Ryan Johnson cant direct shit

Very entertaining!  An intriguing whodunit with some laughs to alleviate the tension.  Twisty and turny with never a dull moment.  Great cast and everyone played their part to perfection.   I will admit that Daniel Craig's accent in the movie was annoying to me but not my adult sons (who saw it with me).  I highly recommend this movie.
Great acting and fun plot, especially Daniel Craig as a Southerner!
Very entertaining whodunnit film. Great cast, engaging story, and a nice pace to the film. Somewhat of a throwback (with many nods) to old mystery movies.
